Pre-Game Insights: The T20 Cricket World Cup 2024 Super 8 stage sees a high-stakes clash between undefeated India and struggling Bangladesh.
India holds a dominant head-to-head record against Bangladesh.
India is seeking a title win and aims for a strong performance following a professional win against Afghanistan by 47 runs.
Key batsmen like Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma need to convert starts into significant scores.
Shivam Dube faces pressure with Sanju Samson waiting in the wings.
Hardik Pandya's cameo against Afghanistan offers a positive sign.
India's bowling attack, likely unchanged, will continue to rely on the trio of left-arm spinners, exploiting the helpful Caribbean wickets.
Axar Patel's confidence in this combination bodes well for India.
Bangladesh is facing a must-win situation after a loss to Australia and has grappled with batting woes throughout the tournament.
The lack of power-hitters and underperforming openers hurt Bangladesh's chances.
Captain Najmul Shanto's call for a strong showing against India underscores their determination.
